abstract: Harvey Araton On Tennis column admires level of fitness displayed in men's United States Open final, where Stan Warinka overcame Novak Djokovic; says Warinka is example of how tennis allows players, even relatively late in their careers, to reinvent themselves.

headline.print_headline: A Reinvented Champion for a Physically Enhanced Age
headline.main: Stan Wawrinka Proves Himself a Reinvented Champion

snippet: Wawrinka, who did not win a major before age 28, captured his third with a United States Open victory over Novak Djokovic. A Wimbledon title would give Wawrinka a career Grand Slam....
lead_paragraph: Wawrinka, who did not win a major before age 28, captured his third with a United States Open victory over Novak Djokovic. A Wimbledon title would give Wawrinka a career Grand Slam.
